content.text:
1. FamilySearch: Learn about Swedish research on the FamilySearch Wiki site.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Sweden Genealogy

  2. Here's an article on Swedish family history for beginners, using FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Swedish Family History for Beginners - 2018

  3. Archives.com: Get an overview of Swedish family history on the Archives.com site.

    ☆ AR—Swedish Family History

  4. Get Started: Get started finding Swedish ancestors.

    ☆ AC—Beginning Swedish Research—35:45 - 2014

    • Immigration routes
    • Census and naturalization
    • Passenger lists
    • Family and other records

    ☆ BYU—Swedish Research Tips—17:35 - 2014

    • Where do I start?
    • A few good books
    • Swedish parish registers
    • Five online resources




  5. Learn more about Swedish genealogy in the guide from American Ancestors.

    ☆ AA—Swedish Genealogy

  6. Explore ☆Your Guide to Researching Swedish Ancestors by Barb Snow.

  7. Learn about methods for extending paternal lines in your Swedish research.

    ☆ FS—Find the Unknown Father in Sweden—65:18 - 2019

    Swedish Records
  1. Record Finder: Use the Sweden Record Finder to understand record types for research.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Sweden Record Finder

  2. ArkivDigital: Learn how to use the ArkivDigital record source, available for free at family history centers.

    ☆ FS—Using Name Searchable Databases in ArkivDigital—53:54
    ☆ FS—How to Use Swedish Collections in ArkivDigital—55:26

  3. Learn about jurisdictions and records for Swedish research.

    ☆ RT—Jurisdictions and Records for Swedish Genealogy—19:29 - 2022

    • Parish
    • Chapelry
    • Parish boundary evolution

    • Civil jurisdictions
    • County

  4. Swedish Roots: Explore the Swedish Roots site for help in getting started with Swedish research.
  5. Explore the ☆Forebears.io site for research records.

choices.name: Learn about Sweden Household Examination records.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for household examination records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
Household Examination Records are church books containing information about all the people who lived in a specific parish.

  1. FamilySearch: Learn about Sweden Household Examination records in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    FS—Wiki: Sweden Household Examination Records

  2. Use this FamilySearch Wiki article for vocabulary tips when dealing with Sweden Household Examination records.

    FS—Wiki: Sweden Household Examination Vocabulary

  3. Learn more about household examination records in these videos.

    Household Examinations (Part 1)—21:06 - 2020


    Household Examinations (Part 2)—24:03 - 2020


  4. Example: See an example of a Household Examination record on Arkivdigital.

    Late 1800’s Household Examination Record Example

  5. Explore Sweden Household Examination Records on FamilySearch or MyHeritage.

QUIKLinks

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Swedish research.

content.text:
1. Explore links in the FamilySearch Wiki.
  2. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks, Partners, and GenealogyInTime to quickly search the most common record collections for Sweden.

content.text:
1. QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goals above.They point to collections with 50,000 or more records. When you click a QUIKLink icon, scroll down on the resulting page to see the QUIKLinks.
  2. In the Partners section (near the top of the page), explore additional record collections in FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast and MyHeritage.
  3. 1. Explore the FamilySearch page for Swedish online record collections.
  4. Explore the Europe page of the GenealogyInTime website. Record collections are listed and described in order from newest to oldest additions, including FamilySearch, Ancestry, and many other sources.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Sweden research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the ☆Swedish Genealogy page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the ☆Northern European Research Facebook page for FamilySearch.
  3. Visit the ☆Swedish American Genealogy group on Facebook.
  4. Visit the ☆Swedish Heart Genealogy group on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Sweden.

choices.name: Join a mailing list, community, or message board for Sweden research.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for Swedish (Nordic Countries) research.
  2. Explore the ☆Sweden research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Sweden research.

1. Learn about Sweden genealogy societies in this FamilySearch Wiki article.
